intro: Tithymalus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable tithymalus, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are variable in shape, which contributes to its common name, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
